page.title: 10TEESSIDE AIRPORT SECURITY
page.content:
Extra security measures have been taken because of recent terrorist attacks abroad (eg Beiruit airport, June l985).
The{detection equipment}is as up to date as possible. On all flights to Ireland, the Isle of Man and the Channel Islands{,luggage is searched. Passengers also have to provide additional information for Special Branch officers. As a final check, passengers also have to{identify their luggage}on the tarmac before boarding the plane. This not only makes sure that the luggage is on the right plane but should stop materials such as explosives being added after the luggage has been checked in.
